models.disputes: Each dispute represents a formal challenge raised against an outcome, charge, refund decision, or service delivery. Disputes are review-driven and follow a strict lifecycle from Open through to Resolved or Rejected.
models.investigationNotes: Internal notes added by reviewers during the investigation process, capturing reasoning, findings, and decisions.
models.evidence: Documents and files uploaded by either the disputing party or the internal team to support or refute the dispute claim.
models.activityLog: A chronological audit trail of every action taken on a dispute, including status changes, assignments, and comments.
models.linkedIncidentSnapshot: A read-only summary of the incident connected to the dispute, showing its outcome, timeline, and financial result.

relationships: Each Dispute links to an Incident, Subscriber, Customer, or Payment reference — no standalone disputes allowed
Each Dispute has many Investigation Notes (added by reviewers during review)
Each Dispute has many Evidence items (uploaded by either party)
Each Dispute has many Activity Log entries (auto-generated audit trail)
Each Dispute may have one Linked Incident Snapshot (read-only view of the connected incident)

disputes.reason: Refund not processed after challan was disposed by court
disputes.description: Subscriber claims that challan CH-DL-2025-98234 was disposed by the Delhi court on 12 Jan 2026, but the refund of ₹4,500 has not been credited to their account. They have submitted the court disposal certificate as evidence. The incident was marked as 'Not Settled' but subscriber disputes this classification.

timelineSummary: 05 Dec 2025 — Challan received, added to New Incidents
08 Dec 2025 — Assigned to Adv. Priya Sharma
15 Jan 2026 — Marked as Not Settled (disputed by subscriber)

activityLog.details: Dispute raised from Incident Detail View for IRN-78234

disputes.reason: Lawyer failed to appear at court hearing
disputes.description: Subscriber reports that the assigned lawyer Adv. Manish Gupta did not appear at the scheduled court hearing on 10 Feb 2026 for challan CH-MH-2025-45210. As a result, the hearing was postponed by 30 days and the challan is now at risk of exceeding the 45-day TAT. Subscriber is demanding reassignment and expedited resolution.

timelineSummary: 02 Jan 2026 — Assigned to Adv. Manish Gupta
10 Feb 2026 — Court hearing missed by lawyer

investigationNotes.author: Neha Kapoor
investigationNotes.content: Contacted Adv. Manish Gupta. He claims he was not notified of the hearing date change. Checking internal notification logs to verify.

investigationNotes.author: Neha Kapoor
investigationNotes.content: Notification logs confirm SMS and email were sent on 05 Feb 2026. Lawyer received the email (opened at 06 Feb 09:12 AM). Likely negligence on lawyer's part. Recommending reassignment and performance review.

activityLog.details: Converted from Support Ticket TKT-4521
Auto-assigned to Neha Kapoor based on workload
Status changed from Open to Under Review
Contacted lawyer, checking notification logs
Uploaded notification-log-screenshot.png

disputes.description: Subscriber was charged twice for the January 2026 subscription — once on 01 Jan and again on 03 Jan. Total overcharge of ₹15,000. Subscriber requests immediate reversal of the duplicate payment.

investigationNotes.author: Vikram Singh
investigationNotes.content: Verified with finance team. Payment gateway timeout on 01 Jan caused a retry that went through on 03 Jan. Both charges are confirmed in the ledger. Recommending full reversal of duplicate charge.

investigationNotes.author: Vikram Singh
investigationNotes.content: Refund of ₹15,000 processed via NEFT. Transaction ID: NEFT-2026-01-12-8834. Subscriber confirmed receipt. Closing dispute as resolved.

activityLog.details: Manually created against payment PAY-30291
Assigned to Vikram Singh
Status changed from Open to Under Review
Refund of ₹15,000 approved. Sent to finance for processing.
Refund credited. Dispute closed as Resolved.

disputes.reason: Challan resolution resulted in incorrect penalty amount
disputes.description: The driver Suresh Kumar was asked to pay ₹8,000 as penalty after the contest hearing, but the original challan amount was only ₹2,000. Subscriber alleges the lawyer negotiated a worse outcome than simply paying the original fine. They are threatening legal action against the company and demanding compensation for the difference plus damages. This has been escalated due to the legal threat and the amount involved.

timelineSummary: 10 Nov 2025 — Challan received from Delhivery batch upload
15 Nov 2025 — Assigned to Adv. Rakesh Jain
20 Jan 2026 — Court hearing, penalty imposed at ₹8,000

investigationNotes.author: Priya Malhotra
investigationNotes.content: Reviewed court order. The judge imposed enhanced penalty due to repeat offence on the same vehicle. Lawyer's contest was valid but the outcome was determined by prior violation history which was not flagged during screening.

investigationNotes.author: Priya Malhotra
investigationNotes.content: Escalating to legal head. The subscriber's legal team has sent a formal notice. We need to determine liability — was this a screening failure or an unforeseeable court decision? Recommending partial compensation of ₹6,000 (the difference) as goodwill.

investigationNotes.author: Arjun Nair (Legal Head)
investigationNotes.content: Reviewed the case. This is a screening gap — prior violations should have been checked. Approving ₹6,000 compensation. Also flagging this as a process improvement item for the screening workflow.

activityLog.details: Raised from Incident Detail View for IRN-76901
Assigned to Priya Malhotra
Status changed from Open to Under Review
Priority changed from High to Critical after legal notice received
Escalated to Legal Head (Arjun Nair) due to formal legal notice and compensation decision required
Status changed from Under Review to Escalated

disputes.reason: Refund amount incorrect — partial instead of full
disputes.description: Subscriber received a refund of ₹1,200 but claims the full challan amount of ₹3,500 should have been refunded since the challan was disposed. Finance team processed partial refund deducting service charges, but subscriber says no service charge clause exists in their contract.

timelineSummary: 25 Nov 2025 — Assigned to Adv. Sunita Devi
28 Jan 2026 — Challan disposed, moved to Refund queue

investigationNotes.author: Vikram Singh
investigationNotes.content: Pulled the subscriber's contract (SUB-4012). Contract version dated Aug 2025 does not mention service charge deductions on refunds. The ₹2,300 deduction appears to be incorrectly applied. Checking with finance on the deduction logic.

activityLog.details: Raised from Financials Tab for IRN-79500
Auto-assigned to Vikram Singh
Status changed from Open to Under Review

disputes.reason: Bulk challans not processed within TAT
disputes.description: Subscriber uploaded a batch of 45 challans on 10 Jan 2026. As of today, 12 challans are still in New Incidents queue and have not been screened. The 45-day TAT is at risk for all 12. Subscriber is demanding immediate processing and SLA credit.

activityLog.details: Converted from Support Ticket TKT-5102. 12 of 45 challans stuck in New Incidents.

disputes.reason: Claims challan was already paid before submission
disputes.description: Customer Ravi Yadav says he already paid the challan fine of ₹2,000 directly at the RTO before the subscriber submitted it for resolution. The challan was processed through the system and lawyer fees of ₹800 were deducted. Customer wants a full refund of ₹2,800 (original fine + lawyer fees). Investigation found the claim to be false — no prior payment record exists at the RTO.

investigationNotes.author: Neha Kapoor
investigationNotes.content: Checked RTO payment portal for challan CH-RJ-2025-33456. No prior payment found. The challan was unpaid at the time of submission. Customer's claim appears to be false.

investigationNotes.author: Neha Kapoor
investigationNotes.content: Called customer Ravi Yadav. He initially insisted on the claim but could not provide any payment receipt. When asked for bank statement showing the debit, he said he would send it but never followed up.

investigationNotes.author: Neha Kapoor
investigationNotes.content: 7-day grace period for evidence submission has passed. No evidence received. Rejecting the dispute as unsupported. Notified subscriber and customer.

activityLog.details: Converted from Support Ticket TKT-4800
Auto-assigned to Neha Kapoor
Status changed from Open to Under Review
No evidence provided within grace period. Claim unsubstantiated.

disputes.reason: Commission charged despite challan being dismissed
disputes.description: Subscriber reports that a lawyer commission of ₹1,500 was deducted for incident IRN-80102 even though the challan was dismissed by the court (no action required). Since no legal work resulted in the dismissal, subscriber argues the commission should not apply. The contract states commissions are only for successful contestations.

timelineSummary: 05 Dec 2025 — Assigned to Adv. Deepak Patel
18 Jan 2026 — Marked as Settled, commission of ₹1,500 auto-calculated

investigationNotes.author: Vikram Singh
investigationNotes.content: Court order confirms challan was dismissed due to procedural error by traffic police, not due to lawyer's contestation. The auto-commission logic triggered because the incident was marked as Settled. This is a system logic gap.

investigationNotes.author: Vikram Singh
investigationNotes.content: Discussed with finance and product team. Commission reversal approved. Also flagging this as a product bug — commission should not auto-trigger on court dismissals. Created internal ticket PROD-892 for the fix.

activityLog.details: Raised internally after finance audit flagged commission on dismissed challan
Assigned to Vikram Singh
Status changed from Open to Under Review
Commission reversal of ₹1,500 approved. Sent to finance.
Commission reversed. Product bug flagged. Dispute closed.
